sen.j: 四条通（しじょうどおり）は京都市の主要な東西の通りの一つ。
sen.e: The Shijo-dori Street is one of the major east-west running streets in Kyoto City.
Shijo-dori Street is one of the major east-west streets in Kyoto City.
Shijo-dori Street is one of the major east-west streets in Kyoto City.

sen.j: 平安京の四条大路にあたる。
sen.e: It corresponds to the Shijo-oj Street of Heiankyo.
It corresponds to Shijo-oj Street of Heiankyo.
It corresponds to Shijo-oji Street of Heiankyo.

sen.j: 東は祇園の東大路通、八坂神社の石段下から西は松尾大社まで。
sen.e: It extends from the bottom of steps of Yasaka-jinja Shrine in the east to the Matsuno-taisha Shrine in the west.
It extends from the bottom of the steps of Yasaka-jinja Shrine in the east to Matsuno-taisha Shrine in the west.
It extends from Higashioji-dori Street in Gion, the bottom of the steps of Yasaka-jinja Shrine in the east, to Matsuno-taisha Shrine in the west.

sen.j: 祇園から四条烏丸まで、四条河原町交差点を中心に京都最大の繁華街を形成している。
sen.e: The area along the street in particular around the Shijo kawaramchi Crossing forms the largest shopping and entertainment district of Kyoto.
The area along the street, particularly around Shijo kawaramachi Crossing, comprises the largest shopping and entertainment district in Kyoto.
The area from Gion to Shijo-Karasuma, particularly around Shijo Kawaramachi Crossing, comprises the largest shopping and entertainment district in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: along the street→from Gion to Shijo-Karasuma原文に忠実に

sen.j: 四条室町通が鉾の辻と呼ばれて下京区の中心と見なされるなど、古くから主要な通りとして京都の東西の中心軸である。
sen.e: Its crossing street, Shijo-Muromachi-dori Street, is called Hoko no Tsuji and regarded as the center of Shimogyo Ward, which indicates that the Shijo-dori Street has traditionally been a key road and served as the east-west axis of Kyoto.

Its crossing street, Shijo-Muromachi-dori Street, is called Hoko no Tsuji and is regarded as the center of Shimogyo ward, which indicates that Shijo-dori Street has traditionally been a key road and served as the east-west axis of Kyoto.

Its crossing street, Shijo-Muromachi-dori Street, is called Hoko no Tsuji and is regarded as the center of Shimogyo Ward, which indicates that Shijo-dori Street has traditionally been a key road and served as the east-west axis of Kyoto.

sen.j: 四条河原町から西大路通四条にかけては地下を阪急京都本線が走っている
sen.e: Underground the Hankyu Kyoto Main Line runs between Shijo Kawaramachi and Shijo, Nishioji-dori Street.
Underground, the Hankyu Kyoto Main Line runs between Shijo Kawaramachi and Shijo, Nishioji-dori Street.
Underground, the Hankyu Kyoto Main Line runs between Shijo Kawaramachi and Shijo, Nishioji-dori Street.

sen.j: （烏丸駅-河原町駅 (京都府)間にはその間に地下道が通っている）。
sen.e: (An underground walkway connects Karasuma Station and Kawaramchi Station (Kyoto Prefecture)).
(An underground walkway connects Karasuma Station and Kawaramchi Station (Kyoto Prefecture)).
(An underground walkway connects Karasuma Station and Kawaramchi Station (Kyoto Prefecture)).

sen.j: 四条河原町から四条烏丸では、歩道・車道とも夜間を除き自転車の走行は禁止されている。
sen.e: Riding a bicycle, both on roadway and sidewalks, is prohibited between Shijo Kwaramachi and Shijo Karasuma except in the night-time.
Bicycling, whether on the roadway or on the sidewalk, is prohibited between Shijo Kawaramachi and Shijo Karasuma except during the nighttime.
Bicycling, whether on the roadway or on the sidewalk, is prohibited between Shijo Kawaramachi and Shijo Karasuma except during the nighttime.

sen.j: 2007年5月30日、京都市は、川端通から烏丸通間において自家用自動車を禁止し、公共交通機関だけが走れる「トランジットモール」とする構想を発表した。
sen.e: On May 30, 2007, Kyoto City announced its "Transit Mall" plan where the section between the Kawabata-dori Street and the Karasuma-dori Street will be opened only to public transportations with all private vehicles being banned.

On May 30, 2007, Kyoto City announced its "Transit Mall" plan, whereby the section between the Kawabata-dori Street and the Karasuma-dori Street would be opened only to public transportation, with all private vehicles being banned.

On May 30, 2007, Kyoto City announced its 'Transit Mall' plan, whereby the section between Kawabata-dori Street and Karasuma-dori Street would be opened only to public transportation, with all private vehicles being banned.

sen.j: 実際の制限を試す社会実験などを行い、3年以内の実現を目指している。
sen.e: It aims to put the plan into practice within 3 years after conducting Social experiments of actual limits.
The goal is to implement the plan within three years after conducting social experiments with regard to the actual limits.
The goal is to implement the plan within three years after conducting social experiments with regard to the actual limits.

sen.j: この実験は、同年10月中旬に行われ、そのうち、10月12日～10月14日の一部時間帯においては路線バス・タクシー以外の自動車の進入が禁止されるとともに歩道が拡幅される形で行われた。
sen.e: The experiment was conducted in early October, 2007, where the street were closed to vehicles except route buses and taxis to make the pedestrian path wider for a certain period of time of 12 to 14 October.
The experiment was conducted from October 12-14, 2007, when the street was closed to vehicles except for route buses and taxis in order to broaden the pedestrian path for a certain period of time.

The experiment was conducted in mid-October of the same year, and the street was closed to vehicles except for route buses and taxis in order to broaden the pedestrian path for a certain period of time on October 12-14.
sen.cmt: 原文に合うように書き換えました。

sen.j: 東大路通から、烏丸通までが、路上喫煙等禁止区域である。
sen.e: The street between the Higashioji-dori Street and the Karasuma-dori Street is a Public Nonsmoking Area.
The section between Higashioji-dori Street and Karasuma-dori Street is a public non-smoking area.
The section between Higashioji-dori Street and Karasuma-dori Street is a public non-smoking area.

sen.j: 祇園から松尾大社までの全区間が、京都市道186号嵐山祇園線となっている。
sen.e: All the street from Gion to Matsuno-taisha Shrine is Arashiyama-Gion-sen, Kyoto City Road 186 Go.
All of the street from Gion to Matsuno-taisha Shrine is designated from Arashiyama-Gion-sen, Kyoto City Road 186 Go.
All of the street from Gion to Matsuno-taisha Shrine is designated from Arashiyama-Gion-sen, Kyoto City Road 186 Go.

sen.j: 上側が東側、下側が西側。
sen.e: East is upper and west is lower.
East is upper, and west is lower.
East is upper, and west is lower.

sen.j: 左側が北側、右側が南側。
sen.e: North is on the left and south is on the right.
North is to the left, and south is to the right.
North is to the left, and south is to the right.

sen.j: 交差する道路の特記がないものは主要地方道を除く市町村道。
sen.e: Roads unless specified are operated by local municipalities.
